Key Match Events: Baltimore Orioles thumped the Minnesota Twins 7-2 in Friday's series opener at Target Field.
Baltimore got 5 2/3 scoreless innings from rookie Cade Povich in one of the best starts of his young career.
Minnesota's bullpen was over-extended after Thursday's 13-inning loss to the Miami Marlins.
Baltimore erupted for five runs after Pablo Lopez left the game.
Post-Match Reflections: The Orioles eliminated the Minnesota Twins from playoff contention.
Baltimore secured the No. 4 seed with Friday's victory and will have home-field advantage during next week's AL Wild Card Round.
The loss dropped the Twins to 82-78, completing their historic second-half collapse.
Minnesota went 12-25 over its last 37 games, going from 17 games over .500 and two games out of first place in mid-August to out of a playoff spot by late September.
The Twins have lost four straight series and are 4-10 over their last 14 games despite facing three teams that aren't postseason-bound.
